sentences: Tänan sind kõiki inimeste abi eest.
Inimeste arv linnas kasvab igal aastal.
Meie organisatsiooni eesmärk on aidata kõige nõrgemaid inimeste.
context: The word 'inimeste' is the genitive plural form of the Estonian noun 'inimene', which means 'person' or 'human'. In the genitive case, it shows possession or association, so 'inimeste' would translate to 'of people', 'people's', or simply indicate that something belongs to or concerns people. This form is commonly used when showing possession (e.g., 'the help of people') or indicating a group of people in relation to something.
